references.paper_title: Hunyuanvideo: A systematic framework for large video generative models
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it introduces HunyuanVideo, a major competitor model to the Step-Video-T2V model presented in the main paper, allowing for direct performance comparison and analysis.

references.paper_title: Movie Gen: A cast of media foundation models
references.reason: This work is crucial as it introduces MovieGen, another significant text-to-video generation model, providing additional context for evaluating Step-Video-T2V's performance within the broader field of video generation.

references.paper_title: Open-Sora: Democratizing efficient video production for all
references.reason: The high relevance stems from Open-Sora, an open-source text-to-video generation model, which serves as a key comparison point for evaluating the performance and capabilities of Step-Video-T2V in relation to existing open-source alternatives.

references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper is highly important due to its introduction of a novel architecture that enhances compression ratios in video generation models, which the authors of the main paper adopt and improve upon for their own Video-VAE model.

This paper is highly relevant because it is foundational to the Step-Video-T2V model, providing the core architecture and training methods used in Step-Video-T2V, making it a crucial foundational paper for understanding Step-Video-T2V's development.
